intro: Euphrasia schugnanica, commonly known as the Schugnan scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
